caption: Big fan of bars and restaurants that offer outdoor seating, heat lamps, and a fire pit during a pandemic winter. Wild Days has all three. Wait staff is charming, even if a bit slow. The rooftop bar is lovely.  Food menu is extremely limited, though I'm told that's due to COVID. What they offer (e.g., calamari & pizza) are fine but definitely nothing to rave about. Drink menu has plenty of options though. They also have s'mores service, which is absolutely delightful.
Great music. Cool people.
Great atmosphere

I have no idea what happened to Wild Days - it used to one of the best bars and restaurants in DC. The food has become awful - I had an order of Calamari and it has to have been one of the worst orders I’ve ever had. It felt like the food had been microwaved - my partner had the pizza and felt the same about her food. Not only is it bad, it’s horrendously overpriced, 16 dollars for a greasy overcooked personal pizza. Our service was really really slow and we couldn’t swap the dish out because the kitchen had closed by the time a waiter came by to ask.  I should note the manager was nothing but gracious about the situation and shouldn’t be held to blame.he was very kind and tried to help, but couldn’t. The food is coming from the restaurant downstairs, instead of their own kitchen. I understand this, but should probably be communicated to guests better.  The drinks are good and the rooftop is beautiful - I hope their menu goes back to what it used to be because it’s a shame to see such a great location wither like this. I can’t recommend it until then - there’s a lot of amazing restaurants and bars in the are. Go somewhere that actually wants your business
What a wonderful place to watch the sunset roast smores and enjoy drinks. They have a gas lot fire place which really sets the mood for the colder months.
The atmosphere was great and the service. The food wasn't good and not many selections. The bathroom wasn't clean

I think this place has potential but the bartender Justin is very rude and unprofessional! My calamari was supper late. Even my waitress Taij apologized for it . No one offered to give me napkins when I had my last drink, so I walked up to the bar with my mask on to grab napkins. Justin, the bartender, yelled at me “don’t grab napkins from my bar”. I’m not a child! DO NOT talk to clients like they are children. I’m a grown man. I ignored him and walked away, as I am a general manager myself in the industry.  The food I ordered was super late and the manager never apologized when he brought it to me . The whole experience was overall unprofessional . It reminded me of a college “pregame” bar . The way the bartender spoke to its customers shows their is no training nor standards and the company has an audacity to charge $16 drinks!
Great spot for drinks and socializing. The terrace is worth visiting as it's not common in Arlington.
Large beautiful atmosphere great sound system
Best after hours for workers
The area is too small for holiday parties and the people who worked the door at the hotel are stiff! But it's a cool spot to chill at
The live music is awesome.
Ok

The bartender, Justin, was great. I always love it when a bartender asks me my preferences and then just makes a drink based on my response vs ordering directly off the menu. It feels personalized and it, predictably, perfectly suits my taste.
Beautiful spot, great music and good drinks.

Always has great live performances throughout the week. I would definitely recommend every second and fourth Saturday of the month the DJ plays r&B and hip-hop and the crowd is absolutely beautiful. Good space and environment and don't forget the amazing firepit! Ya gotta get the s'mores

(Translated by Google) Perfect place to have a drink listening to good music, terrace with views and adapted to the cold.  (Original) Perfecto lugar para tomar algo escuchando buena música, terraza con vistas y adaptada al frío.
Nice atmosphere
My kinda spot. Vibe 1000, scene 1000, drinks 1000.
Great ambiance, amazing bonfire spot
Great vibe.
Dope setup, and all the vibes.

OMG....I truly Love this place. Such a gem on the rooftop of this city. Please go on a clear summer night ((Saturday night)and trust me "You will love it too"....the musical artist playing is just extra goodness.
Will at the bar walked us through all the drinks and food and helped salvage a misstep during date night!
Cool rooftop and atmosphere
Good vibes with beer and family
Dope hotel 👌
Great roof top
Happy hour and late night,  always good vibes. Expect typically high DC prices and more than typically beautiful people and decor
Enjoyed my time there
Lit vibes.
Beautiful rooftop. Great music.
This bar located in the Eaton Hotel is a very trendy place. The view is spectacular, so go check it out and have a great time.
Cool atmosphere, expensive
Great space and great service!
A little bit on the pricey side, but it's a bar in a hotel, so that's to be expected. Great atmosphere and modern vibe. Nice collection of outdoor rooftop seating as well.

This is great space and had GREAT service! Good vibes, good people, good drinks and although the menu is limited the food is good too! MUSIC was EXTRA SPECIAL! Bothe the DJ and the live band were exceptional!
Interesting tropical vibe and decent service

Great place on K street NW. Cultural, great options for food and drinks. Keeping the trend going with amazing rooftop deck. Price point can vary $$-$$$. Can go to hang with a group or meet up with friends and intimate enough for date night.
Great rooftop, friendly service
Great different kind of environment. Definitely a must at least once.
Service was slow. The floor is littered with cigarette butts.

Wildays -The rooftop bar of the Eton hotel.  We went for happy hour on a Monday. It rained a bit earlier that day but the sun came out strong so we decided to give the rooftop a try. After exiting the elevator we were welcomed into a modern cozy indoor rooftop space with a stage and the bar. We grabbed two drinks and headed to the outdoor rooftop area.  The outside area is sort of like a large balcony with several large table and chair sets. A few seemed to be marked as reserved but we were reassured by another party that we could could just grab w/e was open. To our dismay the chairs were still a bit damp luckily we were able to find some dry ones. After finishing our first glass of wine we started to feel a bit peckish. After chatting with the host and server we were able to get table service outdoor to avoid walking back and forth for drinks and food.  We ordered the kalbi tacos and the chicken tacos. The kalbi tacos were amazing completely outshining the chicken tacos which weren’t all that good. The wine opened up our appetites obviously because we made another order of kalbi tacos for a total of 2 by the end of the night! Lol  As the sun started to set, the indoor comedy show was starting. We shuffled inside to watch. The acts were mildly funny. The overall experience of wildays was perfect. It’s a bit pricey but definitely a good vibe.
The drinks and the food were tasty and the waiter was attentive. It has a great Lounge feel with good music and great decor.
Live Comedy on Mondays is a sure fire blast. Jordan Segue is putting together a nice showcase. Comedy on a rooftop deck is amazing during the summer!!
Nice view and decor $16 is a more than a bit steep for a mixed drink in DC
I have been trying to call this place for the last 5 days and no one is picking up, I wanted to make reservations but no one has even bothered to pick up the call or even return my calls.
Great atmosphere and great view
Amazing rooftop
Great ambiance, helpful service. Wonderful place to chill and enjoy the environment. They try a little too hard on the signature cocktails, bit do a solid job on the regulars.

Beautiful rooftop on top of the Eaton Hotel. Good cocktails, nice HH. The food is a good price, healthy and creative, and there's something for everyone. They have vegan food and gluten free as well. You can sit inside or out. Outside is open air so smoking is allowed. Bartenders are polite and generally pretty quick. Servers helpful. If it's a really sunny day, there isn't much for shade, so wear sunscreen, or sit inside. It's my understanding that the benches outside aren't always necessarily reserved as they say, but you just must order from the server instead of bartender. There are a few high top tables at each end of outside rooftop which you can stand at and grab your drinks from the inside bar. The restroom is located inside past the hostess stand and then past the elevators. Their are two restrooms and they're unisex. The door is big so be careful, as I've run it over my toes before- ouch. Overall, nice rooftop, though not the classiest of crowds.

Nice rooftop lounge with amazing food! We ordered 3 different tacos and some starters. The customer service was excellent. Everything was so fresh and full of flavor. Good tunes with a cool mosaic on the back wall. An excellent atmosphere to meet up with friends.

I sat at the bar and had fairly bad service (bartender forgot my drink order twice, even after first reminder he served many other customers before I reminded him again and got the drink). I appreciated the vegan options but was underwhelmed. Guac and chips was good, impossible chili dish was decent but too greasy, and mushroom tacos were ok but flavor didn't really work overall for me. I got the burn baby burn and it mostly just tasted like ginger without much Szechuan peppercorn. Given the prices, service, and how busy they were, I wouldn't come back.

Stunning rooftop above the Eaton DC Hotel. While the space is gorgeously designed, the service could use help. On a Saturday, they were understaffed and the front hostess was simply rude and dismissive to our small group that selected a table (with a hefty price minimum). Long lines to enter and at the bar.
Nice place for drinks with colleagues.  Service was a tad slow for Saturday night.
Nice spot for a snack and cocktails. Live music is a bonus.
Nice rooftop bar

I came to wild days for a Friday happy hour. The hostess/manager was extremely rude and abrasive. We had a larger group and no reservation but also arrived at 4pm and there were plenty of seats. We were willing to be flexible on seating or even stand at the bar but the manager was extremely unpleasant and unprofessional. Our server was nice and even apologized for her managers behavior but I will be taking my business elsewhere. The views are not worth the unfriendly.
Not necessarily my scene. Super swanky, club vibe. Good happy hour prices, and the duck tacos after very good. About the vegan queso though
A greenhouse rooftop with personality. Comfortable and Fun!

Wild Days in a bar/live music venue on the top floor of the Eaton Hotel in downtown Washington, D.C. On a street traditionally known as the lobbying capital of the world, Wild Days speaks to a new era for K Street NW- one that is defined by activists and creatives.  Once you enter Eaton, a new lifestyle hotel, take the elevators to the right (near the coffee shop) to the top floor. Once you step off the elevator, you'll be welcomed by a beautifully decorated lobby. Enter through the doors and you'll be in a gorgeous space decorated in mosaic art. There's a large bar and plenty of seats in the room to listen to the live music from the stage by the main mosaic. If it's warm outside, go outside to their rooftop seating. During winter, they have a fireplace for one of the circular tables.  They sell food (tacos!) and have a large drink menu. They have happy hour wine, beer, and a $9 punch (it's usually sweeter).  If you want a great happy hour spot in downtown DC, go here!
Great place with outdoor terrace and fire pit. Food and drinks are great. The performances are fabulous. This is a great place for a date night. Even after work. The Eaton DC is a wonderful place.
Damn place is fabulous! Great music, food, and drink. Don't forget the outdoor fire pit. Oh yeah!
Nice atmosphere

5 stars for decor/ambiance and service and 3 stars for drinks and food. Other reviewers have focused on the former and I agree that the hotel in general and the rooftop bar are über hip and du jour and all that and much needed to keep raising DC’s coolness quotient. Too bad then the food is forgettable at best. But there is little excuse about the drinks program. Get this — all of the cocktails on the menu are prebatched so the bartenders just have to shake them and serve them in appropriate glassware. Now I get how that’s “operationally” convenient but it’s a letdown when they charge 14-15 for a drink that tastes just OK and you cannot customize.
Nice rooftop venue

Excellent place. Bartenders know their cocktails, the design is unique and scenic, the patio is posh. There vegan queso on the menu, you barely see vegan queso even at vegan places. I would take a group of visiting friends here to see the gems we have hidden in dc.

Stunning rooftop bar with amazing food and uniquely crafted cocktails! The view is perfect; plants are STUNNING and the coziness is unmatched. Plus. They have outdoor heat lamps which makes it a fave in the fall/winter! Couldn't rate it more highly!

One of the most amazing rooftop places in all of DC. Spectacular views combined with such a cozy environment and beautiful decor of plants, makes this my favorite spot for drinks anytime. Alex the bartender provided a great customer service experience, would recommend to anyone and everyone that's looking for good and quality food and drinks. Vegan chicharon is a must
Beautifully decorated indoor/outdoor rooftop bar with heated outdoors and chill house/poolside vibes music happening inside. Decent cocktails.
